title: Borges and Literary Theory
description:
The Argentine author Jorge Luis Borges has had an enormous influence on world literature and literary theory. This course will define Borges’ conception of literature, as expressed in short stories, essays, and poetry, then employ it as a frame for understanding several major developments in literary theory and criticism since the mid-twentieth century. In turn, the course will chart Borges’ diverse literary and philosophical influences. 
Key topics will include: authorship; subjectivity; mimesis; possible worlds; translation; postcolonial theory; modernism and postmodernism; literature and philosophy; literature and science.
prerequisite: YCC1111 Literature and Humanities 1 and YCC1112 Literature and Humanities 2 and at least one other Literature module or with the permission of the instructor.
